hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Reversal on Low Follow-Through
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a significant news headline (as classified by a news sentiment engine), if the initial 30-minute price move exceeds 1.5% but the subsequent 90-minute price action retraces more than 50% of that move on declining volume, a fade of the initial news direction is profitable over the next 4-8 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High-impact news often triggers knee-jerk reactions from retail and headline-reading algos. A rapid, high-volume spike followed by a low-volume retracement suggests the initial move was overdone and lacked sustained institutional buying/selling. The fade bets on the 'true' market interpretation being less extreme.
entry_conditions: News sentiment score magnitude > 0.7 (on -1 to +1 scale)
Absolute price move in first 30min post-news > 1.5%
Price retracement > 50% of the initial move within the next 90 minutes
Volume on the retracement period (90min) is lower than volume on the initial move period (30min)
Enter on close of 5min candle confirming the >50% retracement

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to pre-news level OR 8 hours after entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Initial news-driven high/low (beyond the 1.5% move) is breached

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Strategy fails to generate a positive Sharpe ratio > 0.5 when tested across 50+ high-sentiment news events. Success is not regime-agnostic.
